" After thoroughly washing the inside of the plastic bottle, remove the label and separate it for recycling! Closing the lid after compression reduces the volume, making it more economical to collect and transport. The PET bottles separated in this way are "
Plastic raw materials, synthetic fibers, non-woven fabrics, etc. Recycled in many ways!

At Green Cycle, we\'re passionate about making a positive impact on our planet. Our mission is to revolutionize the way people think about recycling and contribute to a more sustainable future for generations to come.

ㆍ Make sure it doesn\'t get wet, straighten it out, stack it one by one, and then tie it up and drain it.
ㆍ Remove vinyl-coated covers, notebook springs, etc., before discharging.
ㆍ Remove the vinyl coating part, tape iron pins attached to the box, aluminum foil, etc., and fold it to discharge.
ㆍ Empty the contents, rinse once with water, squeeze and put in a bag or bundle to discharge.
ㆍ Empty the contents, march once with water, squeeze and put in a bag or bundle together and discharge.
Please dispose of the cartons in the collection box.
Cartons are not the same as paper.
Paper is made into new paper, and cartons are made into different products, such as toilet paper and beauty tissues.
Dispose of it in a pay-as-you-go bag!
receipt gold foil, tin foil wallpaper
3. Paper contaminated with foreign substances, etc.
ㆍ Do not mix plastic-coated flyers, vinyls, or other filth.
Dispose separately in designated outdoor storage areas to prevent mixing with other paper waste.
Remove materials such as straws and plastic before disposing of paper packs.
Dispose of in paper pack dedicated collection bins to prevent mixing with other paper waste.

If there is no dedicated collection bin for paper packs, please tie them with string or another method to distinguish them from other paper items and dispose of them in the paper collection bin if possible.
| Tin cans, aluminum cans (beverage, liquor cans, food cans)
ㆍ Empty the contents, rinse with water, and remove any foreign substances before disposal.
ㆍ Remove materials of different types, such as plastic lids, from metal cans before disposal.
ㆍ Dispose of aluminum foil according to local regulations, such as using designated waste bags.
* Dispose of cigarette butts and other foreign substances separately.
| Other cans (propane gas, insecticide containers, etc.)
ㆍ Cans with remaining contents (lacquer, paint cans, etc.) are disposed of according to local regulations, such as using special-sized crates.
Gas containers should be discharged preferably in well-ventilated areas by depressing the nozzle to completely remove the contents before disposal.
| Scrap metal (air ducts, iron wires, nails, etc.)
ㆍ Ensure no other substances are mixed, then dispose by placing in bags or tying with string before disposal.
Please dispose of metal cans and scrap metal in the metal collection bin.
Beverage bottles, other types of bottles
ㆍ Empty the contents, rinse with water, remove any foreign substances, and then dispose.
ㆍ Dispose without including cigarette butts or other substances.
ㆍ Dispose of glass bottles with care to prevent breakage.
ㆍ If separate containers are available by color, separate and dispose accordingly.
ㆍ If labels can be removed without adhesive, remove labels before disposal.
ㆍ Wrap broken glass products in newspaper or similar materials before disposing in designated waste bags.
ㆍ Return empty deposit glass bottles such as soju and beer bottles to retail stores to receive a refund of the deposit.
ㆍ Check for deposit refund information on bottle caps and labels.
ㆍ Empty the contents. We don\'t accept items with cigarette butts or other foreign substances.
Report refusal of deposit refund and receive up to 50,000 won in compensation!
Please dispose of in the glass bottle collection bin.
PET bottles for drinking water and beverages
ㆍ Empty the contents completely and remove attached labels. Whenever possible, crush the bottle and close the lid tightly before disposing in the PET bottle collection bin.

ㆍ Transparent or semi-transparent bags that allow the contents to be seen should be used to contain colorless polyethylene terephthalate (PET) bottles. Separate them from other plastics and colored PET bottles before disposal.
" Dispose of colorless PET bottles in the PET bottle collection bin."
Make sure to check the material under the recycling mark and separate them according to their types.
ㆍ Empty the contents, rinse with water, and remove any foreign substances before disposal.
* Containers with structures that cannot be rinsed with water (such as toothpaste tubes) should be emptied of their contents before disposal.
ㆍ For pumping containers, remove the internal iron spring attached to the pump before disposal.

Plastic, clothing hangers, toothbrushes, file holders, telephones, fishing rods, strollers, CD/DVDs, travel trunks, golf bags, and other items with materials other than plastic are disposed of according to local regulations, such as using designated waste bags, special-sized crates, or large waste disposal methods.
Dispose of in the plastic collection bin.
ㆍ Shampoo, dishwashing liquid, and other pump-style (dispenser) containers should be disposed of with the pump separated.
If the contents are dirty, please rinse before disposal.
If the lid is made of the same material, compress and close the lid before disposal.
Please separate plastic bags and dispose of them in the plastic collection bin.
ㆍ Empty the contents and rinse with water to remove any substances and discharge them.
ㆍ Drain in a bag to prevent sucking.

* Film, sheet-type, wrap film, packaging materials with a surface area of less than 500 square meters, and contents with a capacity of 30 meters or 30 grams or less, including packaging materials for which separation and disposal instructions cannot be indicated.
Please dispose of plastic materials in the plastic collection bin.

Items such as wrap film, tablecloths, rubber gloves, mats, carpets, and textiles (tents, banners, clothing, bedding, etc.) that cannot be cleaned thoroughly or have foreign substances removed should be disposed of according to local regulations, such as using designated waste bags, special-sized crates, or large waste disposal methods.
bubble wrap can also be disposed of in the plastic collection bin.
Please dispose of food scraps after marching to the water.
ㆍ Empty the contents and rinse with water to remove any foreign substances and discharge them.
ㆍ Remove Styrofoam and other materials, such as labels, and dispose of them.
ㆍ Remove Styrofoam and other materials, such as labels, and dispose of them.
ㆍ When purchasing electronic products such as TVs, foam packaging materials used as cushioning materials should be returned to the place of purchase as much as possible.

ㆍ Coated or bonded with other materials, foam styrene, construction interior. Styrofoam as exterior material, food stains, or foreign substances that are difficult to remove should be disposed of in accordance with local government ordinances, such as pay-as-you-go bags, special-sized sacks, or large-sized waste disposal.
Separate them from plastic containers and plastic items and dispose of them in a separate collection box.
Styrofoam for building materials is an industrial waste.

There\'s an Explosion of Plastic Waste. By 2025, Nestle promises not to use any plastic in its products that isn\'t recyclable. By that same year, L\'Oreal says all of its packaging will be “refillable, reusable, recyclable or compostable.”
The best place to start making a difference is right in your own home. Learn how you can reduce, reuse, and recycle materials to decrease household waste. The tips below will help you get started.
The ultimate test of man’s conscience may be his willingness to sacrifice something today for future generations whose words of thanks will not be heard.

Consumers rank malnutrition, pesticides, obesity and diet-related health issues, and plastic waste from packaging as the most concerning aspects of the food system, according to an EAT-GlobeScan survey.

When it comes to greening your wardrobe, a lot depends on what you do with your clothing at the end of its usefulness to you. We urge you to never send clothing to the landfill. Textile recycling is alive and well in the United States. Almost always, nonprofits that accept donations of clothing will recycle articles that are not reusable.
Most people don\'t realize how much food they throw away every day — from uneaten leftovers to spoiled produce to parts of fruits and vegetables that could be eaten or repurposed.
